input.description: List all tables in the database

content.content:

tool_use_result.stdout:
attendance  event       income      member    
budget      expense     major       zip_code

content.content:
CREATE TABLE event
(
    event_id   TEXT
        constraint event_pk
            primary key,
    event_name TEXT,
    event_date TEXT,
    type       TEXT,
    notes      TEXT,
    location   TEXT,
    status     TEXT
);
CREATE TABLE major
(
    major_id   TEXT
        constraint major_pk
            primary key,
    major_name TEXT,
    department TEXT,
    college    TEXT
);
CREATE TABLE zip_code
(
    zip_code    INTEGER
        constraint zip_code_pk
            primary key,
    type        TEXT,
    city        TEXT,
    county      TEXT,
    state       TEXT,
    short_state TEXT
);
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS "attendance"
(
    link_to_event  TEXT,
    link_to_member TEXT,
    primary key (link_to_event, link_to_member),
    foreign key (link_to_event) references event(event_id),
    foreign key (link_to_member) references member(member_id)
);
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS "budget"
(
    budget_id     TEXT
            primary key,
    category      TEXT,
    spent         REAL,
    remaining     REAL,
    amount        INTEGER,
    event_status  TEXT,
    link_to_event TEXT,
    foreign key (link_to_event) references event(event_id)
);
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS "expense"
(
    expense_id          TEXT
            primary key,
    expense_description TEXT,
    expense_date        TEXT,
    cost                REAL,
    approved            TEXT,
    link_to_member      TEXT,
    link_to_budget      TEXT,
    foreign key (link_to_budget) references budget(budget_id),
    foreign key (link_to_member) references member(member_id)
);
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS "income"
(
    income_id      TEXT
        constraint income_pk
            primary key,
    date_received  TEXT,
    amount         INTEGER,
    source         TEXT,
    notes          TEXT,
    link_to_member TEXT,
    foreign key (link_to_member) references member(member_id)
);
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS "member"
(
    member_id     TEXT
        constraint member_pk
            primary key,
    first_name    TEXT,
    last_name     TEXT,
    email         TEXT,
    position      TEXT,
    t_shirt_size  TEXT,
    phone         TEXT,
    zip           INTEGER,
    link_to_major TEXT,
    foreign key (link_to_major) references major(major_id),
    foreign key (zip) references zip_code(zip_code)
);

content.text: Good. Now let me verify the two parts of the claim: (1) Elijah Allen's phone number, and (2) whether each of his expenses is above the average cost.

input.command: sqlite3 "/Users/david/workspace/claimdb/test_dbs/student_club.sqlite" "SELECT member_id, first_name, last_name, phone FROM member WHERE first_name = 'Elijah' AND last_name = 'Allen';"
input.description: Find Elijah Allen's member info and phone

content.text: Phone number matches: 724-555-5721. Now let me check all of Elijah Allen's expenses against the average.

input.command: sqlite3 "/Users/david/workspace/claimdb/test_dbs/student_club.sqlite" "SELECT e.expense_id, e.cost, (SELECT AVG(cost) FROM expense) AS avg_cost, CASE WHEN e.cost > (SELECT AVG(cost) FROM expense) THEN 'ABOVE' ELSE 'NOT ABOVE' END AS comparison FROM expense e JOIN member m ON e.link_to_member = m.member_id WHERE m.first_name = 'Elijah' AND m.last_name = 'Allen';"
input.description: Check all of Elijah Allen's expenses vs average

content.text:
The results are clear:

1. **Phone number**: Elijah Allen's phone is 724-555-5721 ✓ (matches the claim)
2. **"Spent more than the average on each expense"**: The claim says each of his expenses exceeds the average cost (65.19). However, only 3 out of 9 expenses are above average. The majority (6 out of 9) are below average. This is **false**.

The claim asserts that Elijah Allen spent more than the average on **each** expense, but the data clearly shows most of his expenses are below the average.
